title: Please Identify
content:
Can anyone identify what fonts were used for My and Benefits?

I’m trying to reconstruct the logo and they have given me a very low resolution file.

I would really appreciate if you guys could elp me. Ü

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720061937im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/logo%20copy_6009.jpg)

 [‹ Pardon my ignorance](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720061937/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45315 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Compressed sans on the side of shipping containers - Saa Series B D {Andrew J Sipe} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720061937/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40370 "Go to next forum topic")
author: mikemanuel

comments.content:
The font used for both of the words is called ’James Fajardo’ - and it’s your lucky day as it’s a free one!

[http://www.dafont.com/james-fajardo.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720061937/http:/www.dafont.com/james-fajardo.font "http://www.dafont.com/james-fajardo.font")

JH

Thank you so much.

I love Typophile!

Now, on with my work... ÜÜÜ

A revised version for commercial use with alternate glyphs is available from [MyFonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720061937/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fajardo/james-paul/). And it’s 70 % off till the end of may. So the price is only 2,70 $ …
